com.is2t.mwt.composites
Class FlowComposite

java.lang.Object
  ej.mwt.Widget
      ej.mwt.Composite
          com.is2t.mwt.composites.FlowComposite
All Implemented Interfaces:
ej.mwt.Renderable
public class FlowComposite
extends ej.mwt.Composite

A flow composite is a Composite that lays out its children in rows or columns.

          Lay out direction.
 
Constructor Summary
FlowComposite()
          Creates a new flow composite.
Identical to calling FlowComposite(int) with MWT.HORIZONTAL as direction.
FlowComposite(int direction)
          Creates a new flow composite specifying the direction.
The direction can be MWT.HORIZONTAL or MWT.VERTICAL.

protected final boolean horizontal
Lay out direction.

Constructor Detail

FlowComposite

public FlowComposite()
Creates a new flow composite.
Identical to calling FlowComposite(int) with MWT.HORIZONTAL as direction.

FlowComposite

public FlowComposite(int direction)
Creates a new flow composite specifying the direction.
The direction can be MWT.HORIZONTAL or MWT.VERTICAL. Respectively, the children will be laid out in rows or in columns.

Parameters:
direction - the direction of the layout priority
Method Detail

validate

public void validate(int widthHint,
                     int heightHint)

Lays out children in rows.

If the width (resp. height) of the row (resp. column) is too small for all the components, it creates several lines (resp. columns). The size of each child is set to the child's preferred size.

The parameters define the maximum size available for this composite, or MWT.NONE if there is no constraint.
After this call the preferred size will have been established.

Specified by:
validate in class ej.mwt.Composite
Parameters:
widthHint - the width available for this widget or MWT.NONE
heightHint - the height available for this widget or MWT.NONE
